conclusion: Analyze the flow of liquid from points A, B, and C through the baffles to determine which containers (D, E, or F) they will ultimately flow into.
The image shows three starting points at the top (A, B, C) with colored markers.
The image shows four angled baffle/barrier sticks in the middle section (black, purple, yellow, and mint green).
The image shows three collection containers at the bottom (D, E, F) with purple, red, and green colors respectively.
Liquid from A will flow downward.
Liquid from A will encounter the black diagonal baffle first.
The black baffle is angled downward to the left.
Following the black baffle, the liquid from A will be redirected toward the left side.
Continuing downward, the liquid from A will eventually reach the purple collection container D on the left.
Liquid from B will flow downward.
Liquid from B will first encounter the purple diagonal baffle.
The purple baffle is angled downward to the right.
The purple baffle redirects the liquid from B toward the right side.
As it continues to fall, the liquid from B will reach the red collection container E in the middle.
Liquid from C will flow downward.
Liquid from C won't directly hit any of the middle baffles based on its starting position.
Liquid from C will continue falling toward the right side of the board.
The liquid from C will reach the green collection container F on the right.
Liquid from A will flow into container D (purple).
Liquid from B will flow into container E (red).
Liquid from C will flow into container F (green).
